description: The House passed funding to keep the US government operating until mid-March just hours before a midnight shutdown deadline, capping off a tumultuous two days in which two earlier plans pursued by Speaker Mike Johnson collapsed.
title: House Passes Plan to Fund Government as Shutdown Deadline Nears

description: Cryptocurrency companies are adding to their financial support for Donald Trump by pledging to donate to the president-elect’s inaugural committee.
title: Crypto Companies Kraken, Ripple, Ondo Donate to Trump’s Inauguration

description: Tulsi Gabbard, President-elect Donald Trump’s nominee to oversee US intelligence, toured Capitol Hill this week looking to reassure some Republican senators who have withheld their support so far and appeal to any Democrats who might be persuaded to back her.
title: Trump’s Spy Pick Gabbard Faces a Tricky Climb for Senate Backing

description: The US lifted a $10 million bounty on Syria’s de facto leader Ahmed Al-Sharaa after an American delegation met him in Damascus on Friday, a move it said was needed for Washington to engage with the country’s interim government.
title: US Meets New Syrian Leader Al-Sharaa, Scraps $10 Million Bounty

description: Retailer At Home Group Inc. is shifting some of its manufacturing and product supply lines away from China in an effort to minimize the impact of tariff’s on US imports that President-elect Donald Trump has threatened to impose on Beijing, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: At Home Shifts Some Manufacturing From China on Tariff Threat

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said his government had taken steps to safeguard Brazil’s fiscal rules and reaffirmed his support of incoming central bank chief Gabriel Galipolo, his first public comments since returning to Brasilia following emergency surgery.
title: Brazil’s Lula Says He’ll Stay ‘Vigilant’ on Need for New Fiscal Measures

description: Italy’s Deputy Premier Matteo Salvini was acquitted over his role in preventing a rescue ship carrying 147 migrants from docking in Sicily in 2019.
title: Italy’s Deputy Premier Salvini Not Guilty in Migrant Case

description: Billions of dollars in federal loans to Rivian Automotive Inc., Plug Power Inc., PG&E Corp. and other companies are under threat because of a potential US government shutdown.
title: US Loans to Rivian, Plug Under Threat From Federal Shutdown

description: The office of South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said it welcomes the decision of the Energy Council of South Africa to end work with Bain & Co. after it objected to the relationship.
title: South Africa Welcomes Energy Group Ending Work With Bain

description: Kash Patel has taken his perceived adversaries to court for years. Now that he’s President-elect Donald Trump’s choice to lead the FBI, critics are concerned he’ll use the bureau’s vast resources for revenge.
title: Trump’s FBI Pick Kash Patel Has a History of Suing Perceived Adversaries

description: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck said he’s concerned about UniCredit SpA’s approach of Commerzbank AG, adding to opposition in Berlin to a potential deal.
title: Germany’s Habeck ‘Concerned’ About UniCredit Move on Commerzbank

description: Keir Starmer has confirmed he is appointing trade expert and Labour Party veteran Peter Mandelson as the UK’s next ambassador to Washington.
title: Starmer Names Peter Mandelson as UK Ambassador to US

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will unveil new cabinet on Friday, but his own political future is in serious doubt after a key opposition leader said he’ll vote to bring the prime minister’s government down.
title: NDP Leader Says He’ll Vote to Bring Down Trudeau Government

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer named 30 new Labour peers as he seeks to address the political imbalance in the House of Lords, despite pledging at the election to slim down and eventually replace the upper chamber.
title: Starmer Puts Allies, Union Bosses in Lords Despite Abolition Vow

description: US President-elect Donald Trump has said he’ll quickly negotiate an end to Russia’s war in Ukraine. This has got NATO allies wondering if he’ll withdraw US support for the government in Kyiv and force it to accept a permanent Russian occupation of Ukrainian land.
title: Why Trump’s Promise to End Russia’s War Worries Ukraine

description: Justin Trudeau’s political future has been shaky for months. But the events that threaten to finish him as Canada’s prime minister snowballed into a crisis in a matter of days.
title: Trudeau’s Shocking Call With Freeland Sparked Canada’s Political Crisis

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said that a controversial education bill that had threatened to split the country’s new governing coalition would be fully implemented.
title: Ramaphosa Signs South Africa’s Controversial Education Bill Fully Into Law

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s austerity plan is passing through Brazil’s congress with changes that will reduce its potential savings by only 1 billion reais ($164 million), far less than feared, according to the nation’s finance chief.
title: Brazil’s Haddad Sees Austerity Plan Passing in Congress Nearly Unscathed

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz took a swipe at Elon Musk over his political judgment, escalating a spat between the German government and the world’s richest person.
title: Germany’s Scholz Takes Swipe at Musk for His AfD Endorsement

description: The US Federal Aviation Administration imposed a month-long ban on drones flying over critical infrastructure in New York, a day after announcing the same measure for New Jersey.
title: Drone Flight Bans Extended to New York Critical Infrastructure

description: The House of Representatives could vote on a temporary measure to fund the government and avert a shutdown — albeit briefly, two news networks reported Friday.
title: House May Vote on Temporary Fix to Stop Shutdown, Networks Say

description: Switzerland and the European Union agreed on a deal to ensure the country’s access to the bloc’s single market, hitting an unofficial end-of-year deadline after lengthy and intense talks.
title: Swiss Agree EU Deal, Rebuilding Ties After 2021 Breakdown

description: It was about 3 a.m. when immigration police began breaking down doors and dragging people away from a remote sugarcane cutters’ camp in the eastern Dominican Republic.
title: Trump’s Mass Deportation Pledges Are Already a Caribbean Reality

description: President-elect Donald Trump transfered about $4 billion worth of shares in his media company to a trust that is controlled by his son, Donald Trump Jr.
title: Trump Moves $4 Billion Trump Media Stake Into Trust Run by Son

description: The federal government hurtled toward a holiday shutdown Friday, as President-elect Donald Trump scuttled a bipartisan funding deal only to fail to muster support within his own party for an alternative he backed.
title: Trump-Backed US Funding Plan’s Failure Showcases GOP Fissures

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Musk’s Political Week Rings Alarms From Washington to Europe

description: Capital spending by US manufacturers won’t see the post-election bump many anticipated given uncertainty about the economic policies President-elect Donald Trump will enact after he takes office in January.
title: Uncertainty About Trump Policies Set to Curb Business Investment

description: PARIS (AP) — France’s anti-terrorism court on Friday convicted eight people of involvement in the beheading of teacher Samuel Paty outside his school near Paris four years ago, a horrific death that shocked the country.
title: French Court Convicts 8 people of Involvement in Teacher’s Beheading

description: President Joe Biden on Friday announced plans to cancel student debt for about 55,000 public sector workers, as his administration pushes to zero out balances for more people in the final weeks of his administration.
title: Biden Cancels Nearly $4.3 Billion in Public Worker Student Debt

description: Foreign ministers from Southeast Asia said they need to find stronger approaches to help resolve the crisis in war-torn Myanmar, as doubts grow about the military regime’s ability to hold onto power.
title: Southeast Asian Nations Vow to Ramp Up Myanmar Crisis Efforts

description: South Africa approved a blueprint for opening access to the nation’s vast rail network to private operators.
title: South Africa Approves Blueprint to Open Up Rail-Network Usage

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will travel to China during the second week of January to revive high-level discussions aimed at improving economic ties between the countries.
title: UK’s Reeves to Meet China Vice Premier in Beijing on Jan. 11

description: India’s Parliament concluded its least productive session in more than a year, marred by brawls between lawmakers and opposition calls for investigations into Gautam Adani, the billionaire businessman and ally of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
title: India Parliament Ends Chaotic Session Marked By Protests, Brawls

description: Poland said it would summon Hungary’s ambassador in Warsaw after Budapest granted asylum to a Polish opposition lawmaker.
title: Poland Summons Hungarian Envoy Over Asylum for Fugitive Lawmaker

description: Ukraine’s capital faced a Russian missile attack for the first time in almost a month, a day after Kremlin leader Vladimir Putin offered to hold talks with US President-elect Donald Trump.
title: Ukraine’s Capital Comes Under Renewed Russian Missile Attack

description: Japan’s ruling parties are set to approve a tax reform plan for the coming year without securing an agreement with a key opposition party, raising the risk of further political gridlock for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s minority government.
title: Japan’s Ruling Parties Agree Tax Plan as Potential Ally Objects

description: President-elect Donald Trump has threatened the European Union with tariffs if its member countries don’t buy more American oil and gas.
title: Trump Threatens Tariffs If EU Doesn’t Buy More US Oil and Gas

description: Turkey said the US has exempted it from sanctions on Russia’s Gazprombank JSC, allowing Ankara to pay for gas imports.
title: Turkey Says US Granted Exemption on Gazprombank Sanctions

description: Giorgia Meloni keeps managing a feat that her predecessors as Italian prime minister long struggled with: earning ever greater trust from investors.
title: Meloni Era Is Lifting Italy’s Curse of Forever Doubtful Markets

description: The European Union should consider taking bolder steps such as confiscating frozen Russian central bank assets to compensate Ukraine, the bloc’s top economic official said, downplaying risk warnings from the European Central Bank.
title: EU Economy Chief Open to Confiscating Frozen Russian Assets

description: A delegation of American diplomats arrived in Syria to meet with representatives of several Syrian factions, including a rebel group designated as terrorists — who overthrew the country’s longtime dictator, Bashar al-Assad.
title: US Delegation to Meet With Syria Rebel Group That Ousted Assad

description: In the month Joe Biden has left in office, his administration is focused on using all the resources it has left to deliver military aid for Ukraine and more sanctions aimed at weakening Vladimir Putin’s economy.
title: Too Little Too Late: US Allies Say Biden Strategy Cost Ukraine Chance of Victory

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s dramatic fall is building public support for his biggest political rival — Lee Jae-myung — to run as the nation’s next leader if fresh elections happen.
title: South Korea’s Political Turmoil Raises Support for Yoon’s Rival

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping reiterated calls for Macau to diversify its economy, praising its efforts to promote cultural tourism as the Chinese gaming hub seeks new growth drivers beyond casinos.
title: Xi Repeats Calls for Macau to Diversify as Ex-Judge Takes Office

description: A new wave of political wrangling between Taiwan’s ruling and opposition parties that has involved street protests and lawmakers tussling adds to questions about President Lai Ching-te’s ability to govern one of the world’s most dangerous geopolitical hotspots.
title: Taiwan Protests, Lawmaker Clashes Show Test to Lai’s Leadership

description: Russia is poised for another aggressive rate hike on Friday as the central bank continues to find little success in tackling inflation that has recently accelerated well above its forecast.
title: Russia Braces for Another Steep Rate Hike in Battle on Inflation
